commander.name: Unknown (corps destroyed)
commander.previous_service: Generale Enea Navarini commanded XXI Corps through El Alamein (October-November 1942). Corps destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein. Status of command personnel in 1943-Q2 unknown - corps confirmed destroyed by May 1943 per US Army G-2 intelligence.

supply_logistics.supply_status: N/A - Corps destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942). US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943) explicitly states: 'XXI Corps - Destroyed in Tunisia, May 1943.' Corps was non-operational throughout 1943-Q1 and 1943-Q2. No supply operations applicable to destroyed formation.

weather_environment.terrain_type: N/A - Corps destroyed, not operational in Tunisia 1943-Q2
environmental_challenges: Corps destroyed - no environmental challenges apply
XXI Corps was destroyed at El Alamein (November 1942) and confirmed destroyed in Tunisia by May 1943
Formation did not participate in Tunisia Campaign final battles (March-May 1943)

tactical_doctrine.role: XXI Corpo d'Armata was DESTROYED and non-operational in 1943-Q2. Corps had served as infantry corps for static defense during 1940-1942 Libya/Egypt campaigns. Destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942) with subordinate divisions Trento (destroyed 25 November 1942) and Bologna (largely destroyed at El Alamein). US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943, page 2640) confirms: 'XXI Corps - Destroyed in Tunisia, May 1943.' No tactical doctrine applies to destroyed formation.
known_issues: Corps DESTROYED at El Alamein November 1942
Confirmed destroyed in Tunisia by May 1943 (US Army G-2)
No operational divisions in Tunisia 1943-Q1 or 1943-Q2
Corps never reconstituted after El Alamein losses
XXI Corps designation may have remained on paper but represented destroyed formation

For Tunisia Campaign scenarios, use operational Italian corps: X Corps, XIX Corps, or remnants of XX Mobile Corps

historical_engagements: XXI Corps destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942)

Confirmed destroyed by May 1943 per Allied intelligence

source: US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943, page 2640) - PRIMARY SOURCE: 'XXI Corps - Destroyed in Tunisia, May 1943' (95% confidence)
XXI Corps 1942-Q4 TO&E - documents corps destruction at El Alamein with subordinate divisions Trento and Bologna destroyed (90% confidence)
XXI Corps 1943-Q1 TO&E - Tier 4 research brief documenting non-operational status (85% confidence)
Trento Division: officially declared 'lost due to wartime events' 25 November 1942 (90% confidence)
Bologna Division: largely destroyed at El Alamein, survivors retreated on foot (85% confidence)
NO Italian divisions in 1943-Q2 list XXI Corps as parent formation in their TO&Es (90% confidence)
Italian First Army structure in Tunisia 1943-Q2: X Corps, XIX Corps, but NO XXI Corps divisions identified (85% confidence)
North Africa Seed Units (validated 2025-10-15) - XXI Corps listed for 1943-Q2 but historical evidence contradicts operational status (75% confidence in seed accuracy)
Comprehensive search of Resource Documents: No operational records for XXI Corps in Tunisia 1943 (85% confidence)
validation.aggregation_method: Unable to aggregate - XXI Corps confirmed DESTROYED. US Army G-2 intelligence (July 1943) explicitly states corps destroyed in Tunisia by May 1943. Corps was destroyed at El Alamein November 1942 and never reconstituted. No subordinate divisions identified for 1943-Q1 or 1943-Q2.

corps_destroyed_status.reason: CRITICAL FINDING: XXI Corps confirmed DESTROYED per US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943, page 2640): 'XXI Corps - Destroyed in Tunisia, May 1943.' Corps was destroyed at Second Battle of El Alamein (October-November 1942) with subordinate divisions Trento (destroyed 25 Nov 1942) and Bologna (destroyed El Alamein). No evidence of reconstitution found. Corps may have remained as paper designation but represented destroyed formation throughout 1943.
sources_checked: US Army G-2 Order of Battle of the Italian Army (July 1943) - PRIMARY AUTHORITATIVE SOURCE
XXI Corps 1942-Q4 TO&E documenting El Alamein destruction
XXI Corps 1943-Q1 TO&E Tier 4 research brief
All Italian 1943-Q1 division TO&Es - NONE reference XXI Corps
All Italian 1943-Q2 division TO&Es - NONE reference XXI Corps
Italian First Army structure showing X Corps, XIX Corps (no XXI Corps)
corps_destroyed_status.mitigation: RECOMMENDATION: XXI Corps should potentially be REMOVED from 1943-Q1 and 1943-Q2 seed file due to confirmed destroyed status. Alternative: Retain in seed with notation as 'destroyed formation' for historical completeness. Corps was destroyed at El Alamein November 1942 and confirmed destroyed by Allied intelligence May 1943. No operational role in Tunisia Campaign 1943.
corps_destroyed_status.estimate_method: No estimation possible or appropriate - corps confirmed destroyed.

Seed file may include destroyed formations for historical completeness, or may contain data error. Seed file lists battles including 'Tunisia' for XXI Corps, but no evidence of actual Tunisia operations found.
sources_checked: US Army G-2 July 1943 contradicts operational status

subordinate_divisions.reason: No Italian divisions in 1943-Q2 Tunisia list XXI Corps as parent formation. XXI Corps subordinate divisions in 1942-Q4: Trento (destroyed 25 Nov 1942, never reformed) and Bologna (destroyed El Alamein, no 1943 extractions). No replacement divisions assigned to XXI Corps in 1943.
sources_checked: italian_1943q2_101st_trieste_division_toe.json - Parent: Italian First Army (not XXI Corps)
All 1943-Q2 Italian division files searched - ZERO units under XXI Corps
subordinate_divisions.mitigation: No mitigation possible - subordinate divisions destroyed and not replaced. Corps ceased to function.
subordinate_divisions.estimate_method: No estimation - subordinate_units array empty due to corps destruction.

all_operational_data.reason: XXI Corps confirmed destroyed at El Alamein November 1942 and by US Army G-2 intelligence May 1943. No equipment, personnel, tactical, or operational data exists for non-existent formation. All values appropriately set to zero or 'N/A' to reflect destroyed status.
sources_checked: US Army G-2 Order of Battle (primary source)
all_operational_data.mitigation: Tier 4 extraction appropriate - this documents historical destruction, not operational capabilities.
all_operational_data.estimate_method: No estimation attempted - corps destroyed status confirmed.

final_destruction_timeline.reason: XXI Corps destruction timeline: (1) Second Battle of El Alamein (23 Oct - 4 Nov 1942) - corps subordinate divisions Trento and Bologna destroyed; (2) 25 November 1942 - Trento officially declared 'lost'; (3) Late 1942 - Corps reduced to skeleton strength (~3 battalions + artillery group per 1942-Q4 TO&E); (4) 1943-Q1 - No operational divisions identified; (5) May 1943 - US Army G-2 confirms corps destroyed. Exact disbandment date and formal dissolution orders not found in available sources.
final_destruction_timeline.mitigation: Italian Ufficio Storico archives should contain formal corps disbandment orders if issued. German-Italian liaison reports may document final status. NARA Italian military records may have additional details.
final_destruction_timeline.estimate_method: Timeline constructed from available sources - formal disbandment documentation missing.
